qas.question: Who claimed that Maurus was derived from the Greek mauron?
What is the compilation of Isidore of Seville's work called?

context: <a0_0>Isidore of Seville<a0_0/>, writing in the <a1_0>7th century,<a1_0/> claimed that the Latin word Maurus was derived from the Greek mauron, μαύρον, which is the Greek word for <a2_0>black<a2_0/>. Indeed, by the time Isidore of Seville came to write his <a3_0>Etymologies<a3_0/>, the word Maurus or "Moor" had become an adjective in Latin, "for the Greeks call black, mauron". "In Isidore’s day, <a4_0>Moors<a4_0/> were black by definition…"
